JGGGbOgHAnKpcw56d4O8bw.text: Maxwell's is there to rip off gullible tourists, who are homesick for a little American style Bar and Grill. Maswell's is way overpriced for what you get, my salad looked like a bowl of weeds, and if you have food allergies good luck finding a waiter who speaks enough English here to understand you. If they mess up your order... and they will.... don't expect to be compensated just be happy there is food. You are better off cooking at home because the ribs taste like they came out of a microwave. This is not classical American cooking but a cheep imitation with extortionate prices. A far cry to the original theme of the restaurant which was once famous for it Burgers, which were once enjoyed by Dudley Moore and Peter Sellers.

jagpMKSCXC7cUj8iaJgUEg.text: As other reviewers have pointed out, this is just a TGI Fridays with different decor.  The happy hour drinks were watered down, and the food was average at best.  You are better off trying something else in this restraunt-rich area.

2kIA6SiPuJCxD3FlXgzuzw.text: This is an amazing place - massive - always full so you do well to book - the food is absolutely delicious always - quick professional service - not the cheapest place but well worth it - at one time you could use Tesco deals vouchers there but that has stopped now

QIwFuvX9W66zqnAmKEqfuw.text: This place is great for food, a few drinks and a bit of dance when the alcohols kicked in. They hold regular events and the music is always great. The food is quite traditional, however ther is one or two exotic dishes on the menu for food lovers, lots of foreign waitresses which can be a pain in a place with so much music, speak loud and slow and they do bring the right order.

u0DaZhBfl8VOBPOTGfNIPw.text: This restaurant and bar is in the heart of Covent Garden, you can't fail to miss it when you come out of the tube. It is a bit of a tardis - you dont realise how big it is and how many people it can seat (there is a downstairs) until you get in there. I've often enjoyed a drink or two at the bar with friends - it is a good meeting place because it is so central. I can recccomend the cocktails! Only once i've ventured downstairs to try the food. Its good quality and with a wide variety you'll likely find something you want on the menu. Like the other reviewer the staff all seem to be nice and friendly and happy to help you.

aqZL4VPfzRSljmey_4Vzeg.text: This is a great place for lunch with all the family and a fab location. The first thing we noticed was how busy it was but there was a good atmosphere, completely unpretentious and they were great with the kids, even providing something to keep them occupied. The food was great, receiving a thumbs up by all and came surprisingly quickly considering there was 7 of us and how packed the place was. Portions were large and the kids' pudding option was gorgeous. One wanted the chocolate brownie, the other fruit kebabs but they shared both as their portions were also generous and each came with vanilla ice-cream. Our waitress was really attentive without being annoying and actually seemed to enjoy serving us. Whether this was genuine or not, it worked and her positive attitude provided us with an equally positive experience especially as service seems to be a thing of the past. If I had to fault this venue in any way, I would have to say that it was a bit noisy. The music was also a bit fast and was repeated quite a few times. You can't expect quiet in such a busy place but a review of their music selection could up my rating to 5 stars.

0HxSBBzQmkX_BQ4zhjeJrQ.text: Maxwells is the first obvious place you come across on exiting Covent Garden tube station. It's cheerful, loud and can be good fun if you're in the right mood. It's has a southern American diner feel about it, which extends to the huge portioned burgers and greasy chips. The cocktails are incredibly watered down but cheap. The bar area can get very lively and loud as the night goes on and the staff are good fun.

XgcIRKiruf2m2Y-i6_1zcg.text: Had a meal with my family here a couple of weeks ago and had a really good night! The food was a little expensive for what it was (very similar to TGIs) but luckily I wasn't paying! The atmosphere was the best part of the night and meant we wanted to stay for desserts and drinks. Staff were polite and really attentive and the food was quick to be served. Overall, a really good night out - definitely recommended - but not if you're short of cash!

of3xn0c4OVW6BJqmQafGKg.text: After trapsing all around the area of Covent Garden, not knowing where to go, we finally found Maxwell's. It was excellent. The food, the service and the staff were all first class. We had a 6 year old with us who didn't want anything on the menu, as it was quite late at night, and she wanted a ham sandwich, we asked them if they could do it and they were only too pleased to help. They are a great company with great staff. I would reccomend it to anyone.

OFcwKBmiaTlV1n-j10i66Q.text: I've been to Maxwells twice.  The first time everything was excellent, the second time everything was good.  What took away from the second time was the seating (they sat us at the bottom of the flight of stairs and my chair was wobbly) and despite me and my mum ordering the same main, her steak was visably bigger than mine...but hey it was her birthday.  Still though the food was good and the staff are always excellent here.The cocktail happy hour is really cool.  All cocktails are less than 4 quid and the cocktails are delicious.  My mum does not drink, but I think I got her hooked on the baileys banana colada.  The cocktail waiters are stylish and you get a good bit of patter with your drinks.  Great vibe at the bar.The atmosphere in general is really buzzing here, I had a lot of fun both times I visited.  Food tastes good, theres a great selection and the portions are pretty big.  I picked up the tab both visits and you're looking at about £90 for 2 people (thats starters, mains, desert and a couple of drinks) so not too bad for a classy restaurant like this.

jc5QTt20M3wEkNgA_rIwHg.text: I was really looking forward to coming here for dinner as I love the whole American diner thing, but  have to say, I was definitely a little over optimistic. On arrival, despite booking for 8pm we were seated at 8.20pm and treated in quite an abrupt and unfriendly manner. I had the burger which was nice but was drenched in sauce which took away the flavour of the meat itself. I also feel that the menu in general is very expensive for what you get, and we were also rushed to finish so that the next customers could be seated.The place was filled and despite the service and the meal not being too great, there was a good atmosphere. It is such a shame that I didn't really feel encouraged to stay longer for drinks at the bar but I was completely put off by the general manner of the staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Maxwell's Bar & Grill - London, United Kingdom

ffOwpv5lPFAvevhG5bPuAw.text: came here for a late dinner after we couldn't find anything else open and were feeling desperate for food. our waitress was really sweet and the food came out quickly but was all bland or overly salty and greasy. our cocktails were too sugary and very sweet. i wouldn't come back

kCoKbKBjMznxPxo6SFtPZg.text: Had cocktails here after dinner last night. They just had the standard cocktails you see everywhere but they were done quite well. The barman was charismatic, I think he was French, at one point I ordered three butterscotch cocktails for me and two other guys and he gave me a withering sarcastic French look. So I asked him "that's a good cocktail right?" and he just looked at me again, and said "eet ees a girly cocktail." Much laughter ensued. He earns a extra star for this place by himself.

XRXGwJEChk41cLLhsvNf0g.text: Maxwells is a rich version of  TGI Fridays. Its prices are overly expensive and the food was nothing special. The main luring point of Maxwells is their Monday night offer, which consists of half price main courses and cocktails, of which there was hardly any alcohol in. When my girlfriend and I arrived, the restaurant was rather busy but they seemed to have enough staff on hand to take care of everyone. We were seated under the stairs and left for over 20 minuets to chose what we wanted, even though we had signalled our waitress numerous times that we were ready to order and were on a tight schedule as we had a musical to attend too.When my ribs arrived (around 45 minuets after ordering) they were dry and chewy... but this was hidden under the piles of sauce that would of made a plastic fork seem like it was one of their ribs. We then received the bill and found that the ribs were only 1/3 off... very misleading!I would not recommend this lace unless you had money to spare and all the time in the world to wait for your drinks and food.

y4AyWAa4Q8YUGYcAU8V3hw.text: Brilliant restaurant/grill. I've been there for cocktails (they have a lot of happy hour periods, 2 for 1) and I always have a really good time. I usually drink cocktails way too fast, but for some reason in Maxwells, two usually can keep me talking and gossiping with friends for about 2 hours! Service is good and prices are good considering the quality and location! Would recommend to anyone for food or just drinks.

9o3QCVkE8s4G9ppkDH1kbA.text: Now here is a rip off if ever I have seen one. I only went here because I managed to grab an outdoor seat which makes for a perfect view of Covent Garden and a street performer or two. It was pure fluke to sit outdoors and took a bit more waiting than usual. The good news is that there is no smoking, yeah! But don't come here for the food. I got the ribs and they were dry and chewy - yuck! I was hoping to drown them off in barbecue sauce to make up for it but t is hard to get a waiters attention so I eat them as given. My partner had a salad and was not thrilled with the quality. All in all, not a good food experience (in fact an awful one) except that we enjoyed sitting outdoors and the view.

OSuEURGd8LEJ4FiE5jqDIA.text: Actually, the best meal we've had here in years!  Thanks for the scrumptious Thanksgiving menu.  Lovely food, excellent service!  A go-to place for us pleasing both the Americans and Brits in our crowd. Good for adults and families with kids.  Excellent location.

r5ScpYiU0HMJ8n_4mIBKsQ.text: Maxwells is great. It's a place to go and get a big burger. No hassle, no nonsense; just big burgers. Big Buffalo Wings to start, a big burger to fill you up, and a big ice-cream to leave you promising never to eat again. Maxwells have got it right; Standard American-style dishes, a nice atmosphere between all the wooden tables and noise, with an array of celebrities painted along the walls.This place is on two levels. Upstairs is half-bar, half-restaurant, and downstairs is more seating. Downstairs is where I like to be. Traditionally I go for a meal here on my birthday every year with friends. I'm not sure why we go here; in all honesty it's not the best restaurant ever and I have, at times, had pretty bad service here. But bad-service is fine by me, it allows me to not feel guilty about my poor tips. If you're going to go here; you MUST get the Buffalo Wings; as they are pure magic. The place is moderately expensive but you could do worse. The good thing about going to Maxwells is at least you'll be full. I'd imagine this place could be great on certain nights; whereas my friends always seem to leave slightly disappointed.

HIVlv9ddcUr7beU-l8aZcA.text: I have to recommend the Mojitos. They are the BEST I have ever had in my life. I frequented this restaurant several times during the month I was in London. I don't remember anything about the food, but the mojitos were so fresh and were different than I have ever had. The sugar was a deep brown and perfectly muddled with the mint. The raspberry mojito was excellent too. Pina Colada also excellent.

oE857S-XT3QZoTI7RW6xyw.text: I don't think I will be coming here ever again. I came just the once and my friend ended up having her phone stolen by a guy begging for money. I don't know how he got in in the first place nor how he even managed to slip by staff unnoticed to get himself all the way downstairs to where we were sitting. The food was fine, I had a burger, I've had better, I've had worse. Nothing about this place really sticks to my memory, except for the phone incident, which I'd much rather forget...

PaD9Ea32jSgrEqyBkfjYhw.text: Went here for lunch one afternoon and it was one of the worst experiences I have had service wise. The first person to take our order was really friendly and attentive, all seamed good. We then had to wait over an hour for our starter of nacho's. A few minutes after the nacho's finally arrived our mine coerce arrived when we was still eating the starter, not only was we not ready for it my order was wrong and the second person to serve us wonted to leave our mine coerce on our table( not that there was room on it) to get cold as we finish our starter. This incident really put us off going here again, saying that the food was good and the vibe of the place is quite cool but could have a bit more of that personal touch. Its a bit like a TGI's.

tlRZyqOLKgCHToGoK924MQ.text: I have lost count of the number of times I've eaten at this branch of Maxwell's. Having been brought up in Hampstead, and spending many a happy evening in their (now sadly closed) Hampstead branch, Maxwell's in Covent Garden is the venue of choice when you care more about the people you are with than the venue you are taking them to. The menu is varied, with no real surprises. There is a good selection of alcohol, and they do lunchtime specials on Mondays, imaginatively called Monday Madness. The staff are always friendly, although getting prompt service is sometimes a bit of a mission when it's busy. Being an American themed restaurant, they fall short of the mark when compared to somewhere like Ed's Diner, but the burgers are good and tasty, and the chips are decent. Portion sizes don't disappoint, and it's a delight to see fresh-ish salad being served on the side. I've had several birthday parties there - and everyone always has a good time. It's reasonably priced and there is always something on the menu for everyone. Their selection of deserts is also great - and their banana split is excellent. There are better eateries in the Covent Garden area, but Maxwell's is always a crowd pleaser.

KqSVA8voOxeX6UPcW4v5tw.text: When I'm out about the town for a big evening with my mates, the night often starts at Maxwell's. They have a great cocktail happy hour, which extends to up to 50% off on food on Mondays (try the burger, it's one of the best in London), which is always a good way to get started. The decor gives off a very trendy feel, which resonates with the standard of clientele. Although there is no dress code, most people are very well dressed and there are no beer louts about. In reference to some of the negative comments; it's often referred to as an American Diner, however, it's not. It's a bar and grill. Ed's Diner is an American Diner. Others say that the cocktails are watered down, which I have experienced only during happy hour when I first started frequenting Maxwell's. The fact is that it is dependant on which bartender is making your drink. It also helps if you to get to know them, if you are a regular. There are a few let downs. Slow service at peak times, drinks can be quite expensive when you're outside of happy hour, overall quality and quantity of food isn't remarkable for what you are paying, waitresses harass you for drink orders when you sitting near the bar (then you have to tip them, and Americanism I'm not fond of). All in all, it's definitely worth a visit for you to see for yourself, some love it, some hate it. I'm there at least once a month because I always know what I'm getting. 3/5

2cjI3ucWwjCLw6N6jr42Dw.text: Usually a nice place to eat, good value for money with 1/2 price cocktails and 2 or 3 course meals, but sadly I wouldn't recommend this place at a weekend, especially if you want time to enjoy the food. Despite bring St.Patricks day, it wasn't particularly busy, however I felt rushed to order and eat my food, and even had to point this out to a member of staff when a bill was slapped on the table before we had asked for it. I was informed that clearing plates from tables whilst others were still eating was efficient  I'm sorry but in my books and any hospitality books that is outright rude. A really bad experience on many counts.

srZVsqwpPz9PWB-10vSBGw.text: Best nachos in the world. Place is a little wild. Lots going on. Not good for intimate conversation but what do you expect for Covent Garden?

10MoI9ld5UVjBEJ0DnhVXw.text: Maxwells is a great family orientated American themed diner in Covent Garden. After moving to London I found that there were very few places that catered for children, lots say they do but often have no children's menu or filthy facilities and no baby changing unit. Maxwells is situated in the heart of Covent Garden, the staff are friendly and helpful, and there is something on the menu for everyone. The food is very similar to TGI Fridays but 100% better tasting, the drinks/ cocktail menu is also very similar to TGI Fridays and both are of similar prices. It is usually fairly busy but I have never had a problem in getting a table. I have given Maxwells 4 stars, I have marked it down one due to the toilets being unclean when I last visited.

ldHjiex4huzageKzSxkvJw.text: Nice place, but you can get better British food.

Z-ctcsNsGAhCCWgEojJLNQ.text: Just had lunch in Maxwell as must say the Monday Madness deal made it very reasonable. Had nachos to share and got burgers and steak. Service was fast and the food was really tasty. It not somewhere I would ever really have choosen myself (friends who were visiting London for a long weekend decided on it) but now would definately recommend it - I guess it is almost like a TGIs or similar but nicer in my opinion..

X8cjPQFdhIgaJCPtM2qLng.text: Well, I thought this place was okay! It has a very nice layout and there are alot of people to hand to ask for assistance, no matter what time of day it is or how busy. There are two floors - a huge place in my opinion, with two full bars and lots of seating for people who are eating. The food is way over my price jurisdiction though so you won't catch me eating here. I'm not paying up to £10 for a burger meal! They do a super extended happy hour system, meaning you can get alot of the usual drinks for lesser prices. There are alot of American people working there and, perhaps as one could expect, they aren't overly helpful. They were far too busy gossiping with each other to come and approach me, even though the place was practically empty! Perhaps give it a miss.

EQ4b8FXQjmmLxDpdR7VZVA.text: This was our pre-game meal before shopping and sightseeing around Covent Garden.  This had been on my list as one of the places I really wanted to go and check out during this trip.  I wanted to keep things light, so I ordered tomato basil soup and a caesar side salad.  They both tasted fine.  Unfortunately, I was so sick after that I had to wrap up our shopping excursion to get back to the hotel for some quality time in the bathroom.  Horrible.  Really terrible.  I can't say for sure that this place made me sick or if I just got a bug, but it was within about an hour and a half of eating here that had me feeling ill.  My friend, who ordered a burger and a shake was absolutely fine, so there is that... maybe why I'm not willing to rate this place with only one star.  I liked the ambiance as well.

Y9z_uz9t_j17KdY_XQS8UA.text: Worst place ever. Keep my money but wish I could get my time back for going to this place. You check this place out online and you would think it's amazing because you see donut burgers, burgers with cheese poured all over it, and extremely exciting looking milkshakes. We showed up for my birthday and we get seated at a 6 person round table that has no room to move around. Everyone in our corner of the restaurant was uncomfortable with how tightly they packed us in there (even though the restaurant seemed to be pretty empty). We ordered drinks and appetizers and our waiter left. 2 minuets later before our drinks even came out, our waiter is pressuring us to order our main course. We convince him to give us a little more time to look over the menu. Everything took forever to come out and when the food finally came out it was disgusting. I'm not picky with food at all but I got the cheese bomb burger and the cheese was the only thing that made the burger edible. It tasted like the burger was cooked, refrigerated, and microwaved. The other people that got burgers at our table agreed. My sisters Mac and cheese was dry and tasteless. I'm upset I spent my birthday here and I wish I could have this night of my vacation back.

kEmjPYdkHSMC3A8W5pf13g.text: Worst restaurant in London!!! Please avoid this place at all cost!  First they make you think it is a super busy restaurant... they put us on a waitlist telling us it was going to take an hour to get us a table, when it took less than 20min We order the vegetarian fajitas, Green Beans tasted like the ones from a frozen bag, onions, green bell peppers and mushrooms were very saggy.. the salsa is not fresh :(  Flour Tortillas tasted like plastic.Second dish was the Couscous Salad which it was tasteless - no balance at all...it felt like we were eating just plain cold pasta...Very disappointed. We wanted to try desserts and order the Oreo FreakShake the sandwich on the top was the only thing good, the milkshake was mixed with lumps of whipped cream.. giving it a weird taste... I couldn't finish it ... after half an hour my stomach started to hurt and I felt like I wanted to throw out :(

c3stISNV_T_QbdLF-k5nJQ.text: Disappointed...I went in here for my birthday dinner with five mates. It wasn't planned as all good nights tend to not be!We all had burgers which were good, but the service was poor. Drinks orders were wrong and didn't arrive.So many different staff on hand but no one really looking after you. It was very busy and our server was cool but clearly had too my going on.It was ok and wouldn't stop me coming back but I think it wouldn't be top of my list.

photos.caption: Photo of Maxwell's Bar & Grill - London, United Kingdom

Zo5COxNe0wl4rq65LnZChQ.text: Me and a few friends went to Maxwells two weeks ago as a friend of ours and her boyfriend were visiting from Brussels. There was seven of us on a Friday night. Where to go for dinner? We were lucky to be able to get into Maxwells with just a little wait. About 15 minutes and we were seated and got menus. Since we had already gotten drinks from the bar while waiting the waiter did not have to get us any. He seemed a little disappointed when we ordered only food.The food was good, some had Mexican food while a friend of mine and me had a tranditional burger. At GBP 10.95 for a burger I was hoping for a good one. Luckily, it was and it certainly was enough to deal with my appetite.We had a few more drinks and when paying, we added a little tip (to cover the service charge - I think service charge is inappropriate for a small group but hey, instead of a tip ...).All in all, good food, not too long wait even on a Friday ...

VMVPotm6b0etaQ0zmC6WFw.text: Service was a bit slow, hence the 4 stars but the food was good and the atmosphere is nice. Great music :)

owPuNhpo3heMFWPt-5nzsg.text: I've never had dinner here, just drinks, and I must say that if you take the Monday offer, cocktails are good enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Maxwell's Bar & Grill - London, United Kingdom. Cocktails on a Monday

tIXCjesUsVdFWY0QoyZZdw.text: The service, food, atmosphere and value for money is great. I've been here only twice but look forward to going again.Friendly staff, short waiting times for food and interior decor make for an enjoyable experience in Covent Garden.

D23Zp03KekG0fvyqxkCKVQ.text: I would not go here again. That's not to say my experience here was awful or that the food was bad, it's because Maxwells is tediously average restaurant. And what's the point in going to a tediously average restaurant when you're in London??In one of the greatest cities in the wold Maxwells has no place. Sure it boasts history and great burgers, but the reality is - move over there are plenty of bigger boys out there now to rival. For some reason this is where my friend decided to have her 25th Birthday meal with a group of around 8. Cocktails are half price most days till 8pm. They were watered down, bland and just not right. All came in tall glasses and were rubbish versions of their famous originals. The Pina Colada was just cream in a glass and others sicky sweet. I ate the tequila infused veg fajitas (at £14.95 a little pricey) and the Mrs Prawn fajitas, (at £16.95 very pricey for a non-mexican restaurant). Safe to say I couldn't tell if anything was infused. The sour cream and salsa came out in those horrible paper ramekins that get soggy quickly. It took a while for the food to come out (even with a group of 8 taking their time umming and ahhhing). I just can't think of anything positive about the resturant itself. Too Loud, too dark, too garish. The only reason I've given this 3 stars and not the 1 or 2 it deserves is Reese. Reese was our waiter who was stuck at work because we turned up. He served with amazing enthusiasm, cheeky sense of humor and efficiency and patience. That boy deserves a bonus because he is just what good service is all about!

WMkUGLAWfaFjNMDQbJp2og.text: Walked in because it was the only busy place at 1130pm.  Waitresses stared at us and walked past us without even a greeting.  We had to ask to be seated!  2 other strikes against them.  1) friend asked for a cabernet sauvignon, but was given a pinot grigio. 2) saw a mouse scurrying out from their storage room and circled my friend's chair.  Thanks for the old world authenticity, but no thanks.  Lost my appetite.  Fat ZERO star.

25Rexn4FhqVzUbU33kYsjw.text: Staff really friendly but the food wasn't that great and left a lot to be desired. The ketchup is in a Heinz Bottle but isn't actually heinz which I thought was really cheeky.Toilets were flooded.

nV5J_neWDM6TQQj_TJpjdg.text: Londoners, I'm sorry but this is not how American food tastes. Sorta close but no banana. Took advantage of their Sunday Meal deal and ordered the nachos appetizer with the rib & chicken combo. Nachos were way off. It looked like nachos and had all the stuff that usually goes in nachos but nuh uh. Not so much. Meat concoction was super sweet and odd tasting with the cheese? Same with the ribs and chicken. Toooooooo much BBQ sauce. Omg. Out of the meal I think I made myself like the ribs and were impressed they weren't fatty like American ribs usually are. I did feel a bit queasy after the meal though. My husband ordered the calamari appetizer (decent) and pulled pork sandwich (he got a bit nauseous all day afterwards). The Mac and cheese our friends ordered was reddish orange. How is that possible? Kraft Mac & Cheese has nothing on this crazy orange cheese color.

pBUkDUNEbmx_BsYbG-tcQA.text: Burger, meh!Steak, meh!Service so slow that we decided not to order desert, in the fear we might not receive it before Christmas.

JCnUEeFI1wSnFFhsx167eg.text: Popped in to Maxwells after a show a couple of nights ago.  It was fine - we decided to get a bunch of appetizers since it was late.  We got a couple of garlic breads (with cheese, of course), some soup, and the chicken sampler.  The garlic bread rocked my world.  Buttery, cheesey, garlicky deliciousness.  The chicken sampler - it was a'ight.  Nothing spectatcular, but nothing offensive.  Didn't live up to the garlic bread, but not much would.Our server was fine - no concerns on the time front like others have mentioned, but it was late and the place wasn't too crowded.Will I make a point of going back to Maxwells?  Probably not.  But I wouldn't avoid it were I in the area either.

U48H2KOaW6eV2dxLwZj7UQ.text: Simple lunch with wifee and munsters! Quick service, Moretti beers, burgers.  This is clearly a joint for tourists/visitors. Yes, me. The service is quite fast, the servers are friendly and the menu is simple but appropriate.Location is outstanding, I was told (secondhand) that you can sit outside on the pedestrianised street for a fee? Confirmation required.If you're a visitor on your way to Covent Garden you could do way worse, if you're local and taking your significant other for fine dining you probably have already found somewhere sexier. Me, touristing (is that a word?) with wifee & kids? Great.

fqli6H8F9DBjO2ih4TWPKw.text: This is the place we used to go with colleagues every first Wednesday of a month just for a couple of pints and a nice chat. It was a tradition. The place is cool. It is very authentic and classy. We moved our meetings to another place though since the location is more convenient for everyone.

bRgEUnDHKdnwizkOHkisRg.text: This rather large and pretty much "only for tourists" restaurants has a lot of stark pluses and minuses. Let me try to list them out.Plus 1. Awesome happy hour. Lasts all through sunday. You get any cocktail for £3.95 during this period.Minus 1. The cocktails aren't that good. My first order was a "long beach iced tea". It was very weak and watery and not at all like what this drink should be. My second, a concoction of lemon and whisky, was more enjoyable though.Plus 2. There is a decent selection on the menu, with quite a few mexican alternatives for the vegetarians among us. Its a place which won't shut anybody out for a lack of choice.Minus 2. The food is grossly overpriced given its quality. Its not that i am averse to paying £14 for a peri-peri chicken with fries ... but this place didn't deserve it.Plus 3. We were lucky to get a very understanding waiter. He was patient and understanding even though some people in our group hadn't arrived even an hour past the reservation time on a busy sunday evening. He also didn't crib when we handed him 6 cards at the end and asked him to split the bill equally.Minus 3. A big chunk of the waiting area is in the basement where you don't get a cell phone signal. Naturally your friends will be an hour late if they can't reach you. Finding someone in this huge restaurant can be quite difficult.Plus 4. Maxwells definitely makes the best cheese nachos i have ever had. I am sure that my experience of this dish hasn't been extensive ... but what i had here ranks at the very top, and by quite a margin. The crab cakes were very good too.Minus 4. But that cannot be said about all the food items. The steak i got was pretty small and the buffalo wings were rather ordinary.Maxwells is located within 30 metres of the Covent Garden market. This is a place which is perfectly suitable for tourists roaming around covent garden who don't mind paying £27 per head for pretty average food ... they are here to spend money and help our economy anyway :) But if you know the city, there are significantly superior alternatives available within a very short walk.

eMsUFb2T2zRt1Go0Cr6AVw.text: I walked in at 11p.m. and looked at the specials menu which was supposedly offered until midnight. I was not seated, not helped. In fact, I was just stared at.When inquiring about the specials, I was told that the kitchen was closed. Hmmmm...Awful.

MdtLW_YBZ5xUZzTv3Yrmsw.text: Hmm, I do believe people are being a tad harsh to Maxwells, but then again, that could be explained by the fact that I only pay half-price at this establishment, thanks to my TasteLondon card, so my expectations are only halfway theirs.The place has little character, lots of crowds and decent food. What I found note-worthy during 1 of my several visits was their commendable service for a particularly crowded place. I had asked for my steak medium and I was nearly through my meal when I noticed a splash of red not quite common for a medium steak. When I brought it to the attention of the staff, the manager came by to offer me a new meal. Considering I was nearly through, I wasn't very keen so he sent the two of us a very nice cocktail each, which was good enough to be dessert, really. I see myself going back there on those 'whatever' evenings when I just want to get myself a burger or a steak.

VSLO2-HuR9NmCEGzT_gBjg.text: Having never even heard of this place, I waltzed in here with a couple of friends so that they could eat prior to hitting a club (wusses! Don't they know they're just going to need more alcohol?!), and it did not disappoint.There were a few groups of people at the door waiting to be seated, on a Thursday night, around 9pm. Arguably quite a good sign!I can't comment on the food itself, as I didn't touch any of it personally, but I heard quite a few appreciative om nom noms from both my friends as they somehow ate portions that looked bigger than they themselves would be, should they curl up in a ball and 'allow' me to throw them in the oven.What I can comment on however, are the drinks. I worked myself through some 4 or so cocktail options, a few of them several times in a row, so I feel like I can make quite a sound judgement here. I loved them all! What helped even more was that our waiter actually *knew* their cocktails (one of the things that truly annoys me is when the server doesn't actually know anything of their cocktails, making it nigh impossible to pick something to your tastes when they don't have your usual picks), and was able to place recommendations to me based upon his own tastes and what he felt matched my description of what I wanted.Speaking of, waiters. Mmmm. It would appear they pick 'em good here! Or at least, a couple of them. Ladies be warned, or indeed, men be warned not to come here, as every single lady in the place was pretty much just checking out this one waiter here. Even to the extent that I overheard a small argument between a couple on whether she should just break up with her partner to marry said waiter.Of course, it was our table that made a phone number exchange with him.Of course.(I am the ultimate wingman)(You'd better call her, boyo! WE KNOW WHERE YOU WORK!)The prices here can add up quite quickly, with dishes hitting up to the £11 mark (didn't see higher, but as a non eater, didn't look too hard), and we actually managed to spend £75 pre-tip, on a meal, two starters and a looooot of drinks. It helps however that between 10 and 11 is cocktail happy hour, whereby they all go from £5.95/£6.95 to £3.95.If you're in the area and after a fix, be it food or drinks, I can recommend this place. The atmosphere was pretty laid back and comforting, as previously mentioned.Enjoy! ;)

FuqPSkFY-uNN6r5b7o9Pdw.text: Always a fun place to go for a casual reunion or some good old western comfort food. From burgers to hot dogs and mac and cheese, this place is truly a haven for live music and cheerful vibes. Situated by Covent Garden and lots of nice shops, it's a great place with impeccable service and emphasis on entertaining customers. They introduce seasonal offers and exciting new specials. I always recommend the shared nacho platter. As it's good value for money. It's very big and you get plenty of nachos even for 3 people it's a good size with extra cheese! Moreover the dessert menu is my favourite! Their freakshakes and soda floats are what make this restaurant such a classic American diner. The setting here is a bit dim with the music sometimes being super loud. If you're not into clubbing but like some live evening entertainment with drinks then this is definitely tour place to go!

XcW-CRWxNQ-srjAgFWXEgw.text: Great location, good layout, and decent food -- but service has an opportunity to improve.If you are in the mood for some comfort American style food, Maxwell's has you covered. I enjoyed my burger and fries (which I also added some cheese sauce too). Even though I didn't get one --- the milkshakes looked pretty impressed and the other customers seemed to enjoy them.Unfortunately, the service was lacking (at least when we were there). We dropped in on a Sunday afternoon when the crowds were gone -- so the wait time wasn't too terrible --- but our server's attitude was poor. When we asked for our drinks to be refreshed from another server, we experienced the same unwelcoming attitude. Additionally, our menus and final check were just tossed on the table. I think this place has a lot of potential. I just think we visited during a bad time.

photos.caption: Photo of Maxwell's Bar & Grill - London, United Kingdom. Out front

jayKDMJNH1g7Zm35QbF-gQ.text: place is a madhouse on any weekend night. honestly, we only ended up here when most of the pubs around covent garden didn't have any seating. the food was very good, but the service was pretty bad. we were told it would be about 30 min for a table so when we asked if we could sit at the bar to eat, the host agreed. the bar tender and manager winked at each other like we were doing something wrong because we were ordering food, which rubbed me the wrong way. another member of  my party kinda got snippy with the manager after the incident and they were able to miraculously "find us" a real table on the second floor. i feel like we were being discriminated against because we were americans

nHEzv--3j4r0MLkNsSVUVg.text: Unfortunately when you take a chance on a touristy restaurant it doesn't always pay off. Maxwell's promised a fun, American diner style atmosphere but did not deliver.We were the first ones in at lunch and it slowly filled up. Having placed our order, drinks and appetizer came out in a reasonable time. My Coke float was nostalgic and simple. The cod sticks were quite tiny, having a total of four. They tasted good thanks to dipping sauce.Then things got odd when our server asked who wanted their salad dressing on the side. Since my friend and I both ordered salads, we confirmed it was hers. Not long after, my Chicken Caesar salad arrived without mention of her Chopped Chicken salad. We assumed it would be a moment later. We waited five minutes while we flagged down the server. He said it would be out soon. After waiting even longer her salad arrived without any dressing. When we stopped another server to ask for it there was confusion and a conversation with our server to get her dressing. No apology for the wait or explanation.The server was strange throughout the meal and we didn't feel valued. Not to mention my salad was average. Probably not the best choice at a diner / bar but they had 4 salads on the menu.Needless to say I won't be returning nor would recommend this place to anyone who wants an American diner experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Maxwell's Bar & Grill - London, United Kingdom. Coke float
Photo of Maxwell's Bar & Grill - London, United Kingdom. Fried cod sticks appetizer

7LO1Nl2cGWbfhQ9Kscm54A.text: So we came here today on my birthday mainly because I really wanted to try their freakshakes. Anyway, we reserved a table and were seated straight away. Ordered ribs, chicken wings and shrimp for starters. The ribs and shrimp were ok but chicken wings were a little dry though not too bad.For main we had the BBQ chicken which was a little too BBQ sauced up but was ok. The burgers were great. The fries though were amazing. Really tasty and had right amount of crunch. Freakshakes. Oh boy, the Oreo milkshakes were a 5* on their own. Amazing. Milkshake soooo tasty. I finished the lot as did my 13 year old. Hubby had the unicorn freakshake. Looked pretty but got sweeter and sweeter with every mouthful.Overall not a bad place for a meal, will return especially for the freakshakes. Go Mondays for the Monday madness menu, discount prices....except the shakes

photos.caption: Photo of Maxwell's Bar & Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Maxwell's Bar & Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Maxwell's Bar & Grill - London, United Kingdom

qlc_RHL2_GGcx8RCfyHW9g.text: After traversing through the city for most of the day, my friends and I were in desperate need of food. We saw Maxwell's with the pretty Christmas tree outside and decided to give it a go. The freakshake was amazing - I had the oreo one with chocolate ice cream instead of vanilla. They match the price of the shake with the size of it too! Needless to say I couldn't finish it without falling into a food coma. I was really craving fish and chips which they didn't have - so I ordered the appetizer goujons and a side of chips to make my own. The service was great but I would say the food is just okay. The ambience is nice and the decor is beautiful!

photos.caption: Photo of Maxwell's Bar & Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Maxwell's Bar & Grill - London, United Kingdom

vy28F8nBpS9nv0y73LWNWw.text: Went there for their famous "Freak shakes" with my friends. You've got to ask at the bar which ones they serve on the day (you've got only two options). I went for the Mars one and although it was not a bad chocolate milkshake, I can't say that it was in any way close to the famous mars taste I was expecting. But, my friend who went for the Oreo one had better luck ! It was really delicious, and did taste like you would expect (and for the same price as mine, she had an ice-cream sandwich on top). The place was clean and the staff very friendly. A bit on the pricey side (8£) but it should be expected considering the cheer size of the shakes ! Also, I would recommend to go there on an almost empty stomach, they're not joking when they decided to call them "Freak shakes" !

photos.caption: Photo of Maxwell's Bar & Grill - London, United Kingdom. Oreo Freak Shake
Photo of Maxwell's Bar & Grill - London, United Kingdom. Mars Freak Shake

2_SACd98BteBoZ4-5f9pYg.text: Pretty awesome to end my  first day in London. You gotta ask for the exclusive cheese bomb burger. The cheese sauce served on the side was so thin and not too heavy. I was impressed and no trip to maxwells is complete without a freakshake!

photos.caption: Photo of Maxwell's Bar & Grill - London, United Kingdom. Salted caramel freakshake
Photo of Maxwell's Bar & Grill - London, United Kingdom. Cheesebomb burger!

gQHaKcInlMGvIUHNlilyBA.text: Wasn't that impressed.   I decided to eat here since it was close to my hotel.   I come to London once a year and the place always looks busy.I really wanted to chicken pot pie and they were out of it so I ordered a burger instead.   The fries and cole slaw were good.  Burger wasnt.   I dont like beef too well done and they don't give you a choice as to how you want it prepared and mine was well to very well done.   Burger almost looked like one of those remade patty'sService was ok but not impressive.   Sever never brought me water or offered a refill on my soda and it took a while to get the check.   I thought the 12.5 percent service fee was a little high for the poor service.

JE_-SSFVUIgTMwP2GM1mPQ.text: Came here for a doughnut burger advertised online and still up on the website. Apparently it hasn't been made here in over a year but still misleading online...?

ieg4oWDhmTjhTgnC9-4CvQ.text: Decent food!I appreciated that this restaurant was taking a stab at American food. The menu featured several different burger, fajita and comfort food options. We came here late on a Wednesday night after seeing a show. Their "Theater Menu" attracted us. We were impressed by their dessert menu as well. Their "Freakshakes" looked very interesting.My friends both ordered from the regular menu and the theater menu. My one friend ordered Mac n' Cheese bites, Steak Fajitas and a Mars Freakshake from the regular menu. The mac n' cheese bites were fairly good! They were covered in cornflakes and fried. They needed a little salt but other than that I was impressed. He said the Fajitas were pretty good as well. The Freakshake was delicious! The shake was very chocolatey and it was covered in Mars candies. You should definitely get one if you come here! My other friend ordered chicken wings, a burger and a salted caramel donut from the theater menu. The wings were very spicy but fairly decent. The burger was alright but the fries were really good! And the salted caramel donut was delicious! He literally licked the plate. All three courses only cost 14.95 pounds! That's a pretty good deal for that much food. I had an Oreo Cookie milkshake. It was pretty good, I've had better but I still drank the whole thing.I really thought this place would be super touristy but it was fairly decent. The prices can get high but it just depends on what you order. Great place if you're looking for food after seeing a show!

D1CEjgRWFh8aIJept-ZdaA.text: If you are looking for the burger with the jug of cheese they no longer have it! We decided to eat here anywhere and we were disappointed to say the least. The only reason it is getting three stars is due to the fact the Oreo freak shake was amazing. The doughnut burger that took the please of the jug of cheese burger is pretty blah in my opinion. It's not a doughnut that's cut in half and the meat is between the pieces it's a ball of dough wrapped around the entire beef patty. The patty was very bland and the bacon didn't appear to be fully cooked. My wife's burger (the New Yorker) was pretty bland as well. The fires were really good as well helping keep the rating at a three.

photos.caption: Photo of Maxwell's Bar & Grill - London, United Kingdom

5hvAy90cAJc7_Tx2ZK-EgQ.text: Great food priced reasonably. Quickly seated and food arrived in a timely manner. Server was very attentive.

ASuYLXV3evTLWAXG6Ff0rw.text: I've always walked past Maxwell's and thought it looked overly touristy, probably overpriced and somewhere no self-respecting Londoner would ever find themselves. Having finally actually visited last week I don't think that opinion has really changed! It all started well and we were given a great table near the door that was almost in its own area (very thoughtful given some of my lovely girl crew could probably use a bit of sound-proofing ;).But the service was really quite poor - slow, inattentive and bordering on rude. Our main server was friendly when we could finally get her attention (after having to wave at the front of house who stands rooted by the door but is unable to take orders so instead takes even longer hunting down your waitress). The guys that brought over our food need some customer service lessons though, barking at my friends to 'move it' and 'make room' when they were trying to put things down - sure we'll help but either smile and ask nicely or help rearrange it yourselves. We'd been lured in by the freakshakes after succumbing to the hype and I was left disappointed with the salted caramel one I shared with my friend. The shake part was quite bland and the rest was a wasteful amount of squirty cream topped with a dry-ish doughnut. The oreo one across the table looked slightly better but still not worth the money, nor the service experience we had. Will probably leave this one for the (non-yelping) tourists as suspected!

xxnghYWNX942mOx6A6Dfyw.text: I popped into this spot during a flash storm while near Covent Garden. It happened to be Monday, which offers all day happy hour and discounted mains. I had a half roast chicken with fries and a beer for 13 pounds total. Not bad for the neighbourhood.It's a pretty touristy spot and isn't very authentically British, it's actually an American style grill. I'd recommend it for an easy option in the neighbourhood with decent, reliable food and attentive service. The portions were massive. Just expect basic food options.

jjdoxU-lwFfb09sYC1Q0rQ.text: I know why the reviews suck for this place. I was writing mine while waiting for my ridiculously slow waiter whose name I do believe was Daniel. Ordered sprite and water. Water never came. Sprite was gross so sent back and ordered a coke. About 15 minutes AFTER taking my sprite order is when he came back for my food and coke order. The Caesar salad was gross. Just ridiculously bland. I added pepper, lemon and vinegar to help make it have a taste. How do you ruin Caesar salad! Ughhh.. Then ordered the Oreo freakshake. I knew I wouldn't finish it when I ordered but the milkshake part was good. Wasn't a fan of the cookie they used for the cake or even the "Oreo" cookies. Just didn't taste like nabisco oreo to me! From a slow waiter to mediocre food, I just wouldn't tell anyone to go there.

9ORKNqTJ8KisAHpVTCBpJQ.text: My first day in London , hungry and tired. We saw this place Maxwell's and what a lovely lunch that was. Service is so sincere , fast and always with a big smile. We both had steaks , temperatures were fine and tastes was good. Even the sides - especially mash potato- was super.Definetely want to taste again

wU5SnohlDd2EC8ZI2Hl9Rw.text: Really quite disappointed- everything tastes a little synthetic and quality compared to places like bodeans in terms of both taste and portion size was pretty grim. Went specifically to check out the "freakshakes" which were about 40% spray can cream. Aesthetically pleasing but disturbingly bland. Service was prompt- but we turned up early were told we might not be able to have a table until the time we booked (30 mins wait) but could get some drinks at the bar, as soon as we said we'd rather have a walk about and come back we were taken straight downstairs to a restaurant at less than 50% capacity- shady.Over all- not a fan.

y5Z20w6gNhjs1X8OiGFOag.text: An upgrade on bodens!So if you haven't been Bodens then you won't be able to compare the two but as I have done both, I can tell you I prefer Maxwells!It covers the American style foods burgers, ribs and spit roast chicken.The only difference is between the two is the service, the attention to food and spacious seating area.

photos.caption: Photo of Maxwell's Bar & Grill - London, United Kingdom. Mojito's ... Make sure you get it with out the ice !
Photo of Maxwell's Bar & Grill - London, United Kingdom. Passion fruit cheesecake!
Photo of Maxwell's Bar & Grill - London, United Kingdom. Spit Roast chicken glazed with ???, BBQ ribs, chip & creamy coleslaw!

8KapItKxVeANwmC8t-Aaqg.text: Came here for freakshakes but heard the nachos were good (yes!!!nachos). Pretty cool place if you're in London for school like I was and want to come here with friends after a long day of class and the national portrait gallery...Us New Yorkers wanted to compare said freakshakes to Black Tap (milkshakes in NYC that went viral on Facebook) and we were impressed! So much better than the ones we have in New York. I recommended Maxwells to all my friends that are lucky enough to study in London this semester.
